website_summaries.verdict: A fine option for note-taking, especially if you're big into the Evernote ecosystem, but it requires some adapting.
pros: Elegantly designed and lightweight, the Adonit Jot Script 2 feels comfortable in the hand
The Evernote Penultimate app has some nice features, plus the stylus comes with six months of Evernote Premium for free
cons: It's easy to lose the charger, and the stylus can't quite keep up with faster note-taking

customer_reviews.title: A definite must grab for your personal use.
customer_reviews.text: I have six of these. you may laugh, but - maybe I've gotten old, or something but -my fngers are too thick to be flick typing on a phone keyboard. I use on my multiple devices that allow use - may iPads (dedicated pads for different rooms and different uses), and my Kindles. i keep buying 'em. And they're easy to turn on and off, they retain their charge for a good while, but don't take forever to recharge. Essential for all my uses and interface needs.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Decent stylus experience on iPad Air 2
customer_reviews.text: Handwriting recognition leaves a bit to be desired on an iPad Air 2. My Galaxy Note 5 was far superior with its stylus, but I'm not sure if this is the fault of this stylus or the iPad itself. That said, overall, it's an OK enough experience. You can usually tell in context what a word is, but if you are writing anything semi random, like a password where you couldn't contextually tell if a letter is supposed to be a U or a V, you will be in trouble. Pairing the stylus with Penultimate and Evernote was very simple. Charge seems to last quite long.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Writing using the "approved" Penultimate was useless. There is quite a lag, and the line is a quarter inch from where the tip touches. I may also have a bum one as the battery doesn't seem to be holding a charge for more than 10 minutes, let alone the advertised 20 hours. Had to reset my iPad just to get it to pair the first time (which is only through an approved app - doesn't pair directly with the tablet). Every non-powered stylus I've used works better (yes, even the ones with the large rubber balloon tips).
customer_reviews.author: Josh M

customer_reviews.title: Good for use with Electronic Flight Bag
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I didn't buy this for awhile because I wanted to use it with an EFB and bluetooth must be off in flight. However, I realized that bluetooth is only necessary for specific apps... the Jot Script isn't connected and what makes it work is power supplied to the tip. So, it does need to be charged at all times, but I can turn bluetooth off on my device, use Foreflight scratchpad to take notes clearly in flight. No wrist rejection, but the small tip is multitudes better at writing clear and small.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Mac

customer_reviews.title: Junk: do not order, this company does not stand behind its products
customer_reviews.text: Junk - do not order. Mine failed exactly 14 months after initial use. It does not pair with my iPad Air2 and requires recharging in less than 10 min. I contacted Adonit Support and their only response was "sorry, you are out of warranty. Try recharging your device or deleting the app that you are using it with and re-pairing the device". At that point I was left with an expensive piece of junk. Save your money and buy an Apple Pencil or better still if you do not have an iPad Pro get the Wacom Bamboo Fineline -- it is much better.
customer_reviews.author: SameerJ

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it tenfold.
customer_reviews.text: I waited long enough for one of this. There was an offer for a short time for a better price an I snatched. Great item to have. It is a must ! Still learning, not wanting to rush and miss certain details that won't allow me the full use of this great tool. Your imagination is the limit. I am an acrylic painter and charcoal sketcher. As an artist,or so I believe to be, this pen was haunting me from the beginning. I finally got it.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I found this device to be laggy and unresponsive. I tried to use it with Skift and was disgusted by the underwhelming experience, more so when I took into account the hefty price tag of the stylus. I returned it but had to write to Amazon Customer Service in order to receive my refund. Don't believe the hype about this stylus. It does not work as seamlessly as advertised and the company that makes it has some serious nerve for charging so much for it.
customer_reviews.author: H.G.

customer_reviews.title: switching to something like this takes some work and understanding of differences
customer_reviews.text: Using a spongy stylus in the past, switching to something like this takes some work and understanding of differences, but once you get the basic idea and how it works, this makes actually using a stylus on an iPhone, iPad, or any Android very nice for taking handwritten notes, sketches, white-boarding, even handwriting IME support to act as a keyboard. Something so simple, yet so nice to have and use at the same time. This made me actually want to use a stylus, and even my iPad more.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Renfro

customer_reviews.title: Very good stylus
customer_reviews.text: I have an iPad mini 4 and use the 7 Notes HD premium app so I needed a stylus as I don't like to use my finger as a writing tool. I tried another one or two styluses but found them to be to awkward to use and it was like I was writing with a magic marker instead of like with a pen. This stylus makes my cursive writing look like pen writing! It only takes a AAA lithium battery to keep it going and so far I have not had to get a new tip for it . I highly recommend this one over other brands
customer_reviews.author: Jea

customer_reviews.title: useless for notes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stylus for notetaking. There is a lot of lag and there is poor precision. I cannot read my handwriting unless I slow down so much that I might as well type. It would work ok for sketching or drawing but is of little use for taking notes! Sending it back!
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Not a product that stands out ... just ok
customer_reviews.text: If you have high expectations on this "new" stylus ... You will be disappointed. I have used the Jot Pro Touch to take notes and it was good. I thought that because the Jot Pro (two years old) item was not intended to take notes sometimes I had some difficulties to write so when I see this Jot script 2 I though "this will do it" ... I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and makes writing on iPad much easier. Specific pairing with different notes-type apps is not fully functional so I may be missing out on some specific features in apps, but the bluetooth between the iPad and pen work throughout, just the same as my old wide nibbed stylus. Perhaps I have an iPad 2 and it's version of bluetooth is dated. A friend with an iPad Air2 mentioned successful pairing with NotesPlus, which we both use.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Cope

customer_reviews.title: Slow to Respond, Poor Writing
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this pen to give me any kind of good results. I tried three different writing programs (Notes, Penultimate, Evernote). Every time I wrote with it, there was a lag. It kept "cutting across" open loops to "catch up" with the current writing spot. Plus I kept having to kind of tap the screen to tell it I was going to start writing. On the whole, very unpleasant to use.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: After 1 time charging, I can use it quite a long time. Works well with Noteshelf on ipad air 2.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: I love this new tool to my academic note taking collection
customer_reviews.text: The product was strangely hard to set up. There was a slight kink in the pens tip, but once I straighten it back out it worked perfectly! I love this new tool to my academic note taking collection.
customer_reviews.author: Zackery White

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to advertised life.
customer_reviews.text: The pen functions pretty well, but the claim that it functions for 20 hours between charges is greatly exaggerated. If I get 2-3 hours of use before it needs to be recharged I'm lucky. Adonit's tech support said they'd exchange it, but I have to send my pen to them first. Once they verify receipt of my pen, they'll send a replacement. That would have me without my pen for up to 2 weeks - that's pretty bad service.
customer_reviews.author: P. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: like palm rejection
customer_reviews.text: It worked well, maybe 3/5 stars well, for 3 months. It will no longer pair with any of my compatible apps on any of my iPads, It still "works" as a "dumb" active stylus--allowing for more precision than the typical large styluses with the mesh or rubber tips. But all of the additional features--the ones you're paying for, like palm rejection, have stopped working. I have contacted Adonit. They may call me back, but either way, I cannot accept this from an expensive high-end stylus.
customer_reviews.author: goodbean

customer_reviews.title: Not "on point"
customer_reviews.text: I am not very pleased with the performance of this stylus. The first problem is that it does not write "on point". That is "ink' does not appear at the point where the stylus touches the screen. The line is several mm away from the point of the stylus. It is very hard to make precise drawings or handwriting. The second problem is that the stylus no longer charges. I am not sure if the problem is with the USB charger or with the stylus itself. Finally the charge only last about 1 day
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I take a lot of notes on my iPad so I needed a good stylus. So I went along and got this one. It's a nice stylus and all but definitely not accurate. I used to have the stylus with the disk at the tip and that was much more accurate than this. Guess I still have to wait until and accurate stylus is created lok
customer_reviews.author: Haik

customer_reviews.title: The plastic covering on the tip fell off within 30 ...
customer_reviews.text: The plastic covering on the tip fell off within 30 mins of writing time. Honestly, it was hard to accumulate 30 mins, because the palm detection through Penultimate and GoodNotes that this pen offers is hardly apparent. But I got to 30 mins in the first week. When I contacted Adonit directly, they offered a replacement, and sidestepped my question about this being a common issue (which it is, source: the entire Internet...go Google it). It needs returned, because it doesn't work. And because I'm busy, I'm past Amazon's return period. So now I have a $75 tube of milled aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality, lots of options
customer_reviews.text: Great functionality, lots of options. Apparently it's the best for handwriting-- great palm sensitivity, but the technology just isn't there yet. This is just as good as the Apple Pencil
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Did not pair well with iPad. Had to pair it like 100 times. Didn't seem to track well and didn't write well with "palm rejection." The ones that do not use Bluetooth work much better. I returned this item and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TX Dad

customer_reviews.title: MAC devices only for easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought thinking it would work on android device. Can't make it happen on my own so need to contact support. I haven't had time for month since I feel like it was going to be a pain so possibly a wasted purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Fred F. Conner

customer_reviews.title: Decent pen. Adonit Jot Dash is a much better and cheaper model.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pen other than slight hand gesture failure but that is more in the app than the pen (notes plus). I would have given it 5 stars had it not been for it being froZen in pairing mode and now I have to file a warranty claim.
customer_reviews.author: Medic0911

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for iPhone 6 Plus/6S Plus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stylus to use with my iPhone 6 Plus for note-taking for the times when my iPad Pro is not the ideal tool (this is rare); I love this stylus with GoodNotes!
customer_reviews.author: Deon

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift for my brother. He likes it a lot. For me, I don't like it since when holding it or writing with it, I don't feel like using a real pen. The pen which comes with Microsoft surface is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Beryl

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a pen that is more than a nubbin stylus.
customer_reviews.text: I am having some trouble keeping this connected to my iPAD Air 2. The connection is central to hand rejection in apps that support that. The pen is pried right and really is a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great, until you lose the charging thingie.
customer_reviews.text: Pricey and the separate charging dock is light, tiny, plastic and of course it's lost.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Not quite there yet with the quality. I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: Not quite there yet with the quality. I bought this with the intention of doing math homework and taking notes on my iPad, didn't work out too well. I'll try the Next iteration.
customer_reviews.author: edj628

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love my fine point Jot Script. I use it mainly for taking notes on my iPad and with my coloring app. The new version has USB recharging capabilities. It's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Mencke

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT ORDER
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this item 2 times, and both times the charger was either defective or not included in the package at all! Even when the package had a sticker saying it had been inspected....for what??? DO NOT ORDER
customer_reviews.author: Laurie M. Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Best pen for a non-ipad pro.
customer_reviews.text: Best pen for a non-ipad pro. Other that an almost unnoticeable lag, this pen is just about perfect. The fine point on it allows for drawing precision.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a terrible stylus but doesn't out perform the $2 stylus I ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a terrible stylus but doesn't out perform the $2 stylus I got from Duane Reade... not at all worth the money (even when using companion software designed specifically for this stylus).
customer_reviews.author: P T

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it. Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Low quality. Better off using a rubber tip pen. Does not sync well, very frustrating product. After having this product for about 4 months the tip of the pen is about to break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It doesn`t work well as I expect.And the presented Evernote Premium expired even 1 year ago!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Didn't seem to get anything special out of this, I expected better note taking ability and thought more options with Evernote. Still get some artifacts when writing. GoodNotes sill my best notepad which is comparable with the jotScript but again could do same with a $10 stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J Bill

customer_reviews.title: Although it has thinner tip than the rest, screen ...
customer_reviews.text: Although it has thinner tip than the rest, screen precision and resolution of clean writing is sadly at least double to what it would be on single sheet of paper. Plastic to screen interaction need improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Dusan Strugar

customer_reviews.title: Very nice when writing
customer_reviews.text: Very nice when writing. Except i have a lot of difficulties pairing it with my ipad and just for that the review dropped
customer_reviews.author: Louis Philippe Soray

customer_reviews.title: not quite there yet.
customer_reviews.text: Still will continue to use the Jot pro, seems that the iPad isn't ready for a Bluetooth stylus, it is just not reliable enough yet. experienced alot of skipping issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan W.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: lags sometimes when connected to the iPad.. otherwise I don't connect it to bluetooth and works as well.
customer_reviews.author: Miyouko Moto

customer_reviews.title: Read my palm...
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get it to worry for me. It kept reading my palm. Back it went!
customer_reviews.author: M.E.L.

customer_reviews.title: Good for presentations, sketching and others.
customer_reviews.text: The apps are a bit slow and have a drag. Excellent for sketching or outlining presentations, but not yet for note taking. Doesn't feel as natural yet.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Writing on the tablet made easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my iPad mini. Love it. It is now so easy to write on my iPad. I have tried two other types--those with the rubber tips (ugh) and the Adonis Jot Pro that uses the little clear plastic disks. I like the Jot Pro (and use it for my work-issued iPad) but the Jot Script 2 is much better to use and easy to charge. The only downside is that not every app recognizes the Jot Script. But, my two favorite apps do. If you like to write on your table was much as I do, then this is the perfect device--at least until a better device comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Reader

customer_reviews.title: Not a good stylus at all
customer_reviews.text: I am outside USA and I ordered it through Amazon to ship into my country. Amazon did great job to ship it to me very fast. No Delivery issue at all. Now I will come to product review, This stylus is 10th Century stylus, prototype product. After receiving it, I fully charged it, Then I connected it to penultimate , I could see very heavy lag while writing, If I write little faster, This doesn't write complete alphabets. I tried all kind of apps, but this is one of the bad stylus that I would never want to write anything because of its writing quality. I won’t recommend to buy this stylus.
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work on iPad 2!
customer_reviews.text: This device is advertised as compatible with all IOS 7 devices, but be aware that it needs Bluetooth 4, which is NOT on models older than the iPad 3!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. The appearance is very attractable, and I had very high expectation. But today when I got this pen and tried it on my iPad with Penultimate and GoodNote4, the performance totally ruined my expectation. This pen simply doesn't do the job. The tip of the pen is very loose. I guess it is designed to "ink out" when the tip is pressed and stop "ink out" when the pressure on the tip is gone. But it is a bad design. The beginning and the ending part of your line is not detected and when this comes to hand writing it is very annoying. You simply cannot recognize what you've written down.
customer_reviews.author: Chenzhe

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Sometimes works well, sometimes not. It's light and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Pricey
customer_reviews.text: At that price level I expected a more accurate writing instrument. The 53 pen turned out to be much better
customer_reviews.author: LucM

customer_reviews.title: Nice pen!
customer_reviews.text: Work very well with goodnotes4 on iPad Air 2. Now I'm doing my homework with it!
customer_reviews.author: Zhening Li

customer_reviews.title: All I wanted on a stylus
customer_reviews.text: Although I have an iPad 2, the stylus works marvelous. I am using Note Plus app and I am looking forward to get a new iPad to use all the functionalities of this stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Satisfied with the product. Only disadvantage is separate charging unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ozgur BILGIC

customer_reviews.title: I made a bad choice.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with my I-Pad mini. I made a bad choice...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ryan

customer_reviews.title: The stylus that will replace my other stylus
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, as described. Excellent stylus. I use it in conjunction with the GoodNotes app for the iPad. I love this pen, it writes exceptionally well with this app. Only issues I have (which maybe user error) is that at times, I think the positioning of my fingers may turn the pen off from time to time. But aside from that, it's a great stylus.
customer_reviews.author: S. Daily

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great, ontime delivered with good condition shipped. Functional work as normal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best stylus yet, the closest natural hand writing alike experience
customer_reviews.author: JC  G

customer_reviews.title: it works for me!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews I read(and I read a lot of reviews/articles) are mixed, so I wasn't sure if I should take the risk or not. I wanted an active stylus so I ended up taking the risk. So far so good. I use it on my ipad air 2 with a screen protector. I use the app Good Notes and it works perfect. This charger usb is so tiny and cute, but if your not careful, it can be easy to lose. The pen is really light and not heavy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Very best quality I like to very much I f put ...
customer_reviews.text: Very best quality I like to very much I f put the pen clip it will be best in the marketplace
customer_reviews.author: BNA

customer_reviews.title: Great pen, apps suck
customer_reviews.text: Great device. The pen is perfect. My only issue with it is its compatibility with the apps. Penultimate and some of the others have a few bugs that get in the way. I would say penultimate is the worst app. Instead, I use Notability. This app is the best for note taking. It's worth not having the Bluetooth to use this app.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It stop working aftr 2 weeks. It isn't returnable neithr by amazon nor the company. Very disapoonting.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: ... but I've used the 1st edition Jot Script and like it. Adonit has good support
customer_reviews.text: Wrong product was shipped to me but I've used the 1st edition Jot Script and like it. Adonit has good support.
customer_reviews.author: T Carter Music

customer_reviews.title: When I open the package, the case is apparently ...
customer_reviews.text: When I open the package, the case is apparently changed by someone. And the charger is gone. I really need an explanation for this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful device to write with on the iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian van Raay

customer_reviews.title: This device works great. Easy to use and setup was simple
customer_reviews.text: This device works great. Easy to use and setup was simple. It works with non-supported Adoint apps like Microsoft Notes. For best results, use a supported Adoint app. The battery life is great and the weight is perfect - not too light and not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: LG

product_meta.title: Adonit Jot Script 2 - Evernote Edition Fine Point Precision Stylus for iPad, iPad Air, iPad Mini and iPhone
product_meta.description: Jot Script 2 - Evernote Edition is the fine-point Bluetooth stylus designed to simply feel like a pen. Now rechargeable and with free 6 months of Evernote Premium, the Script is a major productivity upgrade for smart note taking and sketching on the iPad.
feature_bullets: Designed to Feel Like a Pen
20 Hours of Use on a Single Charge
Familiar feel: Built with a grooved grip and a new, slimmer barrel

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars356 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
